conversation.content: [exhausted] अरे यार, तुम इस वक़्त यहाँ courtyard में क्या कर रहे हो? [pause] गार्ड्स ने बताया कि तुम शाम से इंतज़ार कर रहे हो, and it's nearly midnight now.
[passionately] मुझे नए orders के बारे में पता चला है, थॉमस—पूरे castle को पता है Blackstone Keep के mission के बारे में। [voice breaking] सब कह रहे हैं यह मौत का सफ़र है, कोई वापस नहीं आएगा जो जाएगा।
[firmly] तुम्हें garrison की gossip नहीं सुननी चाहिए, मेरे दोस्त। [sighs] हाँ, mission खतरनाक है, but I've survived three campaigns already, haven't I?
[angry] मुझसे ऐसे बात मत करो जैसे मैं बच्चा हूँ! [trembling] तुम्हारे squire ने बताया कि सिर्फ़ 12 आदमी भेज रहे हैं सैकड़ों के खिलाफ़, that the king knows it's impossible but needs someone to blame.
[quietly] जो कसम मैंने खाई है वो मुझे orders पर सवाल उठाने की इजाज़त नहीं देती। [pause] जब मैं knight बना था, I pledged my sword and my life to the crown, तुम्हें यह पता था।
मुझे पता था तुम duty चुनोगे, हमेशा पता था। [crying while speaking] लेकिन जानना और सहना अलग बात है, when you're standing here telling me you'll march to your death, मेरे साथ रहने के बजाय।
[frustrated] तो मैं क्या करूँ—अपनी कसमें तोड़कर कायर की तरह भाग जाऊँ? [loudly] मेरी इज़्ज़त, मेरे परिवार का नाम, everything I've built would be destroyed in an instant!
[bitter] तुम्हारी इज़्ज़त मुझे गर्मी नहीं देगी जब तुम किसी unmarked grave में दफ़न होगे। [gasps] हे भगवान, थॉमस, we were supposed to celebrate together next month—मैंने सब तैयारी कर ली थी!
[empathetically] इधर आओ, please. [very quietly] मुझे तुम्हें अपने पास रखना है जब तक मैं रख सकता हूँ, and I need you to understand, यह मैं भी नहीं चाहता।
[whispering] तो मत जाओ। [desperately] हम आज रात निकल सकते हैं, eastern provinces चले जाएँगे जहाँ कोई हमें नहीं जानता, start a new life far from all this madness.
[shaky voice] तुम मुझे लालच दे रहे हो।
[fervently] तो लालच में आ जाओ! [quickly] एक बार अपनी ज़िंदगी में, choose love over duty, हमें चुनो इस बेकार की इज़्ज़त के बजाय जो मरे हुओं के लिए कुछ मायने नहीं रखती!

[regretful] अगर मैं भागा, तो वो हम दोनों का शिकार करेंगे—तुम एक deserter को पनाह दे रहे होगे। [pause] जो ज़िंदगी तुम सोच रहे हो, we'd spend it looking over our shoulders, राजा के न्याय का इंतज़ार करते हुए।
[confidently] कम से कम हम साथ होंगे, कम से कम हमारे पास एक chance होगा! [exhales] यह mission तुम्हें सिर्फ़ एक noble death देता है, which I'm supposed to somehow be proud of.
[warmly] एक बात में तुम सही कह रहे हो—अगर मैं मरा, तो यह जानते हुए मरूँगा कि kingdom के सबसे बहादुर इंसान ने मुझे प्यार किया। [chuckles] अभी भी तुम किसी भी soldier से ज़्यादा लड़ रहे हो।
[sad] मुझे हँसाने की कोशिश मत करो, अभी नहीं। [sniffles] अगर तुम सच में सुबह जा रहे हो, then at least promise me you'll try to survive, कि तुम अपनी जान glory के लिए नहीं फेंकोगे।

मैं वादा करता हूँ कि ऐसे लड़ूँगा जैसे मेरे पास वापस आने की वजह है—क्योंकि है। [passionately] मेरी तलवार का हर वार तुम्हारे पास का रास्ता साफ़ करने के लिए होगा, every moment of fear I'll conquer by remembering your face.
[hesitantly] एक और बात है जो मुझे तुम्हें बतानी है जाने से पहले, something that might change everything. [long pause] थॉमस, मैंने तुम्हारे परिवार से वादा किया है तुम्हारी देखभाल का।
[gasps loudly] क्या? [stuttering] तुमने—उन्होंने—यार, तुमने मुझे पहले क्यों नहीं बताया? This changes everything, मैं तुम्हें ऐसे नहीं छोड़ सकता, अभी नहीं!

[very quietly] मुझे कल सुबह ही पता चला, और मैंने सोचा—मैंने सोचा अगर मैं बताऊँगा, it would make leaving even harder. [crying while speaking] लेकिन मैं तुम्हें जाने नहीं दे सकता यह जाने बिना कि कोई तुम्हारा इंतज़ार कर रहा होगा।

original_conversation.content: [exhausted] Elara, what are you doing out here in the courtyard at this hour? [pause] The guards told me you've been waiting since sundown, and it's nearly midnight now.

[passionately] I heard about the new orders, Thomas—the entire castle knows about the mission to Blackstone Keep. [voice breaking] They're calling it a death march, saying no one who goes will return alive.
[firmly] You shouldn't listen to garrison gossip, my love. [sighs] Yes, the mission is dangerous, but I've survived three campaigns already, haven't I?

[angry] Don't patronize me! [trembling] Your squire told me they're sending only twelve men against a force of hundreds, that the king knows it's impossible but needs someone to blame for the war's failures.
[quietly] The oath I swore doesn't allow me to question orders, Elara. [pause] When I became a knight, I pledged my sword and my life to the crown, you knew this.

I knew you'd choose duty, I always knew. [crying while speaking] But knowing doesn't make it hurt less when you're standing here telling me you'll march to your death at dawn rather than stay with me.
[frustrated] What would you have me do—break my vows and flee like a coward? [loudly] My honor, my family's name, everything I've built would be destroyed in an instant!
[bitter] Your honor won't keep me warm when you're buried in some unmarked grave. [gasps] God, Thomas, we were supposed to be married next month—I've already had the dress made!
[empathetically] Come here, please. [very quietly] I need to hold you while I still can, and I need you to understand that this isn't what I want either.
[whispering] Then don't go. [desperately] We could leave tonight, sail to the eastern provinces where no one knows us, start a new life far from all this madness and death.
[shaky voice] You tempt me.
[fervently] Then be tempted! [quickly] For once in your life, choose love over duty, choose us over some abstract notion of honor that means nothing to dead men!

[regretful] If I run, they'll hunt us both—you'd be harboring a deserter, a traitor. [pause] The life you're imagining would be spent looking over our shoulders, waiting for the king's justice to find us.
[confidently] At least we'd be together, at least we'd have a chance! [exhales] This mission offers you nothing but a noble death that I'm supposed to somehow be proud of.
[warmly] You're right about one thing—if I die, I die knowing I was loved by the fiercest woman in the kingdom. [chuckles] Even now you're fighting harder than any soldier I've known.
[sad] Don't try to make me smile, not now. [sniffles] If you're truly going to leave at dawn, then at least promise me you'll try to survive, that you won't throw your life away for glory.

I promise to fight like I have something to return to—because I do. [passionately] Every swing of my sword will be to clear a path back to you, every moment of fear I'll conquer by remembering your face.
[hesitantly] There's something else I need to tell you before you go, something that might change everything. [long pause] Thomas, I'm carrying your child.
[gasps loudly] What? [stuttering] You're—we're going to—Elara, why didn't you tell me sooner? This changes everything, I can't leave you like this, not now!

[very quietly] I only found out yesterday morning, and I thought—I thought if I told you, it would make leaving even harder. [crying while speaking] But I can't let you go without knowing you might have a son or daughter waiting for you.

scenario: A knight returns from a brutal campaign to find their fiancée waiting in the castle courtyard at midnight, having just learned they've been ordered to leave again at dawn for a suicide mission.
